value.title: Power BI Paginated Reports in a Day - 20: Beyond Report Development - Part 1
value.excerpt: In this video, we describe how to publish reports to the Power BI service, and also cover consuming, delivering, and embedding paginated reports. Finally, we discuss when it's a good choice to create a paginated report instead of a Power BI report.  The Power BI Paginated Reports in a Day online course

value.title: Add or Edit Columns When Importing Data from Analysis Services into Power BI
value.excerpt: If you use SQL Server Analysis Services as a data source for Power BI, you have two types of connection; Live Connection or Import Data. value.title: Basic Sharing, and Manage Permissions in Power BI Simple, but Useful
value.excerpt: Power BI provides multiple ways of sharing content with users. Each sharing method has pros and cons and can be used for specific scenarios. Some of the sharing methods can be used together to build a framework for sharing. In this post, I will talk about the most basic way of sharing Power BI content.

value.title: Combining Tables in Power BI   Union Except and Intersect in DAX
value.excerpt: Power Query is often the engine used for combining data tables, especially using Merge or Append. However, sometimes, you might need to do that operation in DAX. An example of that is when you want to create that combination only virtually as part of a measure calculation that evaluates dynamically.

This is because those values are not explicit measures, they are implicit measures in Power BI. In this article

value.title: Microsoft Power BI: Unleash row level security patterns in Power BI - THR3015
value.excerpt: Security is different from sharing; sharing is about sharing the entire content with others—security is about authorizing different views of the content to others. value.title: Removing the Total Value for a Column in the Table Visual of Power BI Using ISFILTERED
value.excerpt: Table visual is one of the most commonly used visuals. In Power BI, you can turn off the total row (when it won’t make sense to have the total) entirely. However, you cannot turn off the total for some columns and keep it working for the others. Using a DAX function, you can, however, do this easily.
